alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:55AM CST until January 28 at 8:34PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor low lying flooding extends into the floodplain above and below Cuero. Steen Road (between FM 766 and US Hwy 183 near Hochheim) monitored for flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CST Sunday was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 24.1 Sun 8 am CST 11.0 9.3 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CST.
